title: Computer Programming Education for Secondary Practitioners Using Integrated Curriculum Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical computation skills and logical reasoning abilities
context.additional_context: Hybrid education conducted in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments, targeting current secondary teachers and education practitioners

learning_goals: Learners can write algorithms to solve mathematical problems using the Python programming language.
Learners can perform coding practices and receive feedback using mobile-friendly tools.
Learners can improve their code through peer evaluation and apply optimization techniques.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
